slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचअभयं सत्त्वसंश‍ुद्धिर्ज्ञानयोगव्यवस्थिति: ।दानं दमश्च यज्ञश्च स्वाध्यायस्तप आर्जवम् ॥ १ ॥
slokas_translated: The Supreme Personality of Godhead said: Fearlessness, purification of one's existence, cultivation of spiritual knowledge, charity, self-control, performance of sacrifice, study of the Vedas, austerity, and honesty; these are the duties of the Brahmins born of their own nature.

slokas: अहिंसा सत्यमक्रोधस्त्याग: शान्तिरपैश‍ुनम् ।दया भूतेष्वलोलुप्‍त्वं मार्दवं ह्रीरचापलम् ॥ २ ॥
slokas_translated: Non-violence, truth, non-anger, renunciation, peace, compassion, lack of greed towards beings, gentleness, modesty, and lack of fickleness.

slokas: तेज: क्षमा धृति: शौचमद्रोहो नातिमानिता ।भवन्ति सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातस्य भारत ॥ ३ ॥
slokas_translated: Radiance, forgiveness, fortitude, cleanliness, absence of malice, non-egotism - these qualities constitute divine wealth for one born in Bharat.

slokas: दम्भो दर्पोऽभिमानश्च क्रोध: पारुष्यमेव च ।अज्ञानं चाभिजातस्य पार्थ सम्पदमासुरीम् ॥ ४ ॥
slokas_translated: Pride, arrogance, conceit, anger, and harshness, these belong to one born of demoniacal qualities, O Partha.

slokas: दैवी सम्पद्विमोक्षाय निबन्धायासुरी मता ।मा श‍ुच: सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातोऽसि पाण्डव ॥ ५ ॥
slokas_translated: Divine is the wealth that leads to liberation, demonic is that which leads to bondage. Do not grieve, O Arjuna, for you were born with divine qualities.

slokas: द्वौ भूतसर्गौ लोकेऽस्मिन्दैव आसुर एव च ।दैवो विस्तरश: प्रोक्त आसुरं पार्थ मे श‍ृणु ॥ ६ ॥
slokas_translated: There are two kinds of beings in this world, the divine and the demoniac. The divine has been described at length, O Arjuna; now hear from me about the demoniac.

slokas: प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च जना न विदुरासुरा: ।न शौचं नापि चाचारो न सत्यं तेषु विद्यते ॥ ७ ॥
slokas_translated: People do not know the difference between action and inaction; neither cleanliness nor proper behavior nor truth is found among them.

slokas: असत्यमप्रतिष्ठं ते जगदाहुरनीश्वरम् ।अपरस्परसम्भूतं किमन्यत्कामहैतुकम् ॥ ८ ॥
slokas_translated: They say this world has no truth, no foundation, no God. It is produced by mutual contact, what else could it be but desire?

slokas: एतां दृष्टिमवष्टभ्य नष्टात्मानोऽल्पबुद्धय: ।प्रभवन्त्युग्रकर्माण: क्षयाय जगतोऽहिता: ॥ ९ ॥
slokas_translated: Having adopted this wrong view, those with a limited understanding, whose minds are lost, are engaged in harmful actions for the destruction of the world.

slokas: काममाश्रित्य दुष्पूरं दम्भमानमदान्विता: ।मोहाद्‍गृहीत्वासद्‍ग्राहान्प्रवर्तन्तेऽश‍ुचिव्रता: ॥ १० ॥
slokas_translated: Depending on desire, filled with insatiable greed, pride, and arrogance, these impure souls, deluded by ignorance, grasp at false notions and act with impure vows.

slokas: चिन्तामपरिमेयां च प्रलयान्तामुपाश्रिता: ।कामोपभोगपरमा एतावदिति निश्चिता: ॥ ११ ॥
slokas_translated: Engrossed in immeasurable anxiety until the end of destruction, considering sensual pleasures as the highest, they firmly believe this.

slokas: आशापाशशतैर्बद्धा: कामक्रोधपरायणा: ।ईहन्ते कामभोगार्थमन्यायेनार्थसञ्चयान् ॥ १२ ॥
slokas_translated: Bound by hundreds of ties of desire and devoted to lust and anger, they strive to amass wealth by unjust means.

slokas: इदमद्य मया लब्धमिमं प्राप्स्ये मनोरथम् ।इदमस्तीदमपि मे भविष्यति पुनर्धनम्  ॥ १३ ॥
slokas_translated: I have obtained this today. I will achieve this desire. This is mine and I will have more wealth in the future.

slokas: असौ मया हत: शत्रुर्हनिष्ये चापरानपि ।ईश्वरोऽहमहं भोगी सिद्धोऽहं बलवान्सुखी ॥ १४ ॥
slokas_translated: I have killed this enemy, and I will kill others as well. I am the lord, the enjoyer, accomplished, powerful, and happy.

slokas: आढ्योऽभिजनवानस्मि कोऽन्योऽस्ति सदृशो मया ।यक्ष्ये दास्यामि मोदिष्य इत्यज्ञानविमोहिता: ॥ १५ ॥
slokas_translated: I am the most beloved and powerful, who else is like me? Deluded by ignorance, I shall give and rejoice.

slokas: अनेकचित्तविभ्रान्ता मोहजालसमावृता: ।प्रसक्ता: कामभोगेषु पतन्ति नरकेऽश‍ुचौ ॥ १६ ॥
slokas_translated: Confused by many thoughts, entangled in the net of delusion, attached to the enjoyment of desires, they fall into a foul hell.

slokas: आत्मसम्भाविता: स्तब्धा धनमानमदान्विता: ।यजन्ते नामयज्ञैस्ते दम्भेनाविधिपूर्वकम् ॥ १७ ॥
slokas_translated: Those who are self-conceited, stubborn, filled with pride and arrogance, and perform ostentatious sacrifices without following the prescribed rituals.

slokas: अहङ्कारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं च संश्रिता: ।मामात्मपरदेहेषु प्रद्विषन्तोऽभ्यसूयका: ॥ १८ ॥
slokas_translated: Pride, arrogance, conceit, lust, and anger—these are the qualities of those who are born with demonic traits.

slokas: तानहं द्विषत: क्रूरान्संसारेषु नराधमान् ।क्षिपाम्यजस्रमश‍ुभानासुरीष्वेव योनिषु ॥ १९ ॥
slokas_translated: I cast those hateful, cruel beings into the cycle of rebirths as demons in a continuous stream.

slokas: आसुरीं योनिमापन्ना मूढा जन्मनि जन्मनि ।मामप्राप्यैव कौन्तेय ततो यान्त्यधमां गतिम् ॥ २० ॥
slokas_translated: Entering into demonic wombs, those deluded beings are born again and again in such births, O Arjuna. Failing to attain Me, they thus reach a state of lower existence.

slokas: त्रिविधं नरकस्येदं द्वारं नाशनमात्मन: ।काम: क्रोधस्तथा लोभस्तस्मादेतत्‍त्रयं त्यजेत् ॥ २१ ॥
slokas_translated: This threefold gate of hell, destructive of the self—lust, anger, and greed—should be abandoned.

slokas: एतैर्विमुक्त: कौन्तेय तमोद्वारैस्त्रिभिर्नर: ।आचरत्यात्मन: श्रेयस्ततो याति परां गतिम् ॥ २२ ॥
slokas_translated: Freed from these three gates of darkness, O son of Kunti, a man works for the ultimate good and goes to the supreme goal.

slokas: य: शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य वर्तते कामकारत: ।न स सिद्धिमवाप्‍नोति न सुखं न परां गतिम् ॥ २३ ॥
slokas_translated: One who disregards the rules of scriptures and acts according to their own desires does not attain success, happiness, or the supreme goal.

slokas: तस्माच्छास्त्रं प्रमाणं ते कार्याकार्यव्यवस्थितौ ।ज्ञात्वा शास्त्रविधानोक्तं कर्म कर्तुमिहार्हसि ॥ २४ ॥
slokas_translated: Therefore, the scripture is the authority in determining what should and should not be done. Knowing the regulations prescribed by scripture, you should perform your duty here.
